name: Biryani
origin: Originated during the Mughal era, Biryani is a flavorful mix of rice, meat, and spices, showcasing Persian influence in Indian cuisine.

name: Samosa
origin: Introduced to India by Central Asian traders, Samosa became a popular deep-fried snack filled with spicy potatoes or meat.

name: Idli
origin: With roots in ancient Tamil literature, Idli is a steamed cake made from fermented rice and lentils, known for its light texture.

name: Dhokla
origin: A Gujarati dish made from fermented chickpea flour, Dhokla is known for its fluffy texture and sweet-sour balance.

name: Rogan Josh
origin: A staple of Kashmiri cuisine, Rogan Josh is a slow-cooked lamb curry with Persian roots, infused with aromatic spices.

name: Dosa
origin: Native to South India, Dosa is a thin crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter, often served with chutneys and sambar.

name: Chole Bhature
origin: A North Indian favorite, Chole Bhature pairs spicy chickpeas with fluffy deep-fried bread, often enjoyed as a hearty meal.

name: Butter Chicken
origin: Created in Delhi, Butter Chicken features tandoori chicken simmered in a creamy tomato-based gravy with spices.

name: Pani Puri
origin: Also known as Golgappa, this street food originated in Magadh and consists of crisp puris filled with tangy, spicy water and potatoes.

name: Rajma
origin: A comforting dish of red kidney beans in spiced gravy, Rajma is a Punjabi staple served with steamed rice.
